titleStmt.title: J. R. Botts and J. T. Shepherd to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4877

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Grayson Ky Apl 26th 1864
His Excellency T E Bramlette
Governor of Ky
I write you in behalf of William Neithercutt who has been fined by a Jury before P B Hord J P C C Ten Dollars & Costs for a Breach of the peace

The Circumstances are these Philips Caunts Called Defts wife a liar. and Deft whiped him for it There was no one present but the two. Deft was not present at the trial and did not have the proof in Explanation before the Jury. and hence The fine Now I Respectfully ask your Excellency to Remit so much of the fine as lies within your
Power

Respectfully yours
J. R. Botts
J. T. Shepherd
